オプション1: "Th-thanks... You saved me."
The man tried to smile, but his face was constantly strained in pain.
(He looks like he's in pain...)
"Those things attacked me, and I ended up tumbling down a slope. You saw them, right? Those weird things."

"Yeah. Those... monsters crawling all over outside—what are they?
I've never even heard of creatures like that."

"I don't know either... But those things—did you notice how densely packed they are?
I've been thinking... there's something weird about it."
"Didn’t we learn in school once about how much grassland it takes to support a single zebra?"
"Maybe we did..."
"If animals that big were packed that densely, this island would’ve turned into a desert and they’d have gone extinct."
"Maybe they're not creatures of this world. Have you seen them eat anything?"
(They had the smell and freshness of life, but the way they moved was like radio-controlled toys.)
Star Man remembered the children.
"Actually, there are two kids waiting in the mountains... Can I bring them here?"
"Eh... that’s..."
"They can stay in a room farther from here. Please."
"Uh... well... in that case... I guess it’s fine."
"Alright, I’m heading out. My name’s Star Man."
"O-oh. I’m Trapezoid Man. There’s something else on this island besides those monsters. Be careful."
"Yeah. Thanks."
After finishing his meal, Star Man set off toward the children.
